results.title: A Question of attitude
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Martin-Jones and Stuart Glover
results.brief_description: Discusses the problem of finding work for physically handicapped people, showing many examples of successful workers in varied skilled positions. Argues that employers’ reluctance to make positions available is the main difficulty.

results.title: A Queer patient
results.creator_credit: Shanghai Animation Film Studio and Pu Jia-Xiang
results.brief_description: A tale from China centred around the theme of the wolf in sheep’s clothing. A caterpillar admits herself to the animal hospital after becoming ill from eating leaves of protected plants. Unfortunately for her, this is discovered by the medical staff who decide not to let her out. However, the caterpillar metamorphoses into a butterfly and seeks to deceive the hospital staff by playing on the fact that nothing as beautiful as she could do anything destructive. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: A Queen who returned [short version]
results.brief_description: An account of the Queen Mother’s visit to Melbourne and the city’s festivities held for the event. Freatures footage of the Queen Mother at Flinder Street Station, the Exhibition Building, State Swimming Centre and her meeting with some Melbourne dignatories.

results.title: A Queen who returned [B/W]
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria, David Swift and Gil Brealey
results.brief_description: On the 27th of February, Queen Elizabeth, the Queen Mother, arrived at Essendon for a five day visit to Victoria. This film follows Her Majesty through many official functions during her visit including the State Reception, the Queen Elizabeth Stakes at Flemington, the children’s display at the Melbourne Cricket Ground and the memorable State Ball at the Melbourne Town Hall. As an introduction to the film, and as a background to this Royal Visit, we see the City of Melbourne - the old city of the past; the exciting new city of the future; its people and their preparations for the Royal Tour.

results.title: A Quarter million teenagers
results.creator_credit: Los Angeles City School, County Health Department and Robert Churchill
results.brief_description: Present physiological aspects of venereal disease. Discusses gonorrhea and syphilis indetail, explaining how the organisms enter the body, how the diseases affect tissues and organs, and how they may be recognised. Eplains that the diseases can be cured emphasizing the need for early treatment.

results.title: A Psychopath
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson Associates, Robert Anderson and Henwar Rodakiewicz
results.brief_description: A study of anti-social personality disorders. Presents the case history of a convicted burglar of high intelligence, a psychopath whose criminal tendencies constitute a threat to his community. Filmed at Verdun Protestant Hospital with Dr H. B. Durost as the interviewing psychiatrist and commentator.

results.title: A Prospect of Kew
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World about us”.
Richard Mabey goes beyond the showpiece attractions of the Kew Gardens in Surrey to reveal how its two centuries of history and its scientific research has made it the international centre for plant conservation.

results.title: A Proper little mother to them all
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
How does the oldest girl in a family look after her brothers and sisters when the mother has died or gone away? This film is about two such cases. Seventeen-year-old Carole who lost her mother through cancer a year ago, now looks after six young brothers and sisters on her own. Frances, who comes from a family of twelve however, has a father who works and provides for the family, and a Home Help who also does a lot of hard work for the twelve children, but Frances is the only mother the younger children will ever know.
